intro: Sacciolepis kimpasaensis, commonly known as the Kimpasaensis sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
